Class NeonSuitServiceExtensions

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Setup
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Setup.dll

Provides extension methods for registering NeonSuit RSS Reader core services, repositories, infrastructure components, and AutoMapper profiles into an IServiceCollection.

public static class NeonSuitServiceExtensions
Inheritance
object
NeonSuitServiceExtensions
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Remarks

This class centralizes all dependency injection configuration for the backend services. It follows Clean Architecture principles with clear separation of:

  • Database context and EF Core configuration
  • Repository layer (data access)
  • Service layer (business logic)
  • Engines and coordinators (background processes)
  • Utilities and parsers
  • AutoMapper profiles (entity-DTO mappings)

Usage in Program.cs or Startup.cs: 

services.AddNeonSuitBackend("Data Source=rssreader.db");
// or with configuration
services.AddNeonSuitBackend(configuration);

// Ensure database is created/migrated
app.Services.UseNeonSuitDatabase();

Methods

AddNeonSuitBackend(IServiceCollection, IConfiguration, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>?)

Registers all NeonSuit RSS Reader backend services using IConfiguration for database settings.

public static IServiceCollection AddNeonSuitBackend(this IServiceCollection services, IConfiguration configuration, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>? configureOptions = null)

Parameters

services IServiceCollection

The IServiceCollection to add services to.

configuration IConfiguration

Configuration instance containing connection string or database path.

configureOptions Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>

Optional additional configuration for DbContext options.

Returns

IServiceCollection

The same service collection for chaining.

Remarks

Looks for connection string in this order:

  1. Configuration.GetConnectionString("RssReaderDatabase")
  2. Configuration["Database:Path"]
  3. Defaults to "rssreader.db" in current directory

AddNeonSuitBackend(IServiceCollection, string, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>?)

Registers all NeonSuit RSS Reader backend services with explicit database path.

public static IServiceCollection AddNeonSuitBackend(this IServiceCollection services, string dbPath, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>? configureOptions = null)

Parameters

services IServiceCollection

The IServiceCollection to add services to.

dbPath string

File path to the SQLite database.

configureOptions Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>

Optional additional configuration for DbContext options.

Returns

IServiceCollection

The same service collection for chaining.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if services is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if dbPath is null or whitespace.

UseNeonSuitDatabase(IServiceProvider)

Ensures the database is created and all migrations are applied. Should be called once at application startup.

public static IServiceProvider UseNeonSuitDatabase(this IServiceProvider serviceProvider)

Parameters

serviceProvider IServiceProvider

The application's service provider.

Returns

IServiceProvider

The same service provider for chaining.

Remarks

This method creates a new scope to resolve the DbContext and applies any pending migrations. It's safe to call multiple times (migrations are only applied once).
